SEARCH
Package tracker

Class FitnessTrackerTest2

java.lang.Object
tracker.FitnessTrackerTest2
public class FitnessTrackerTest2 extends Object
This class serves to test the calculateDistance, fitnessLevel, and calculateCalorieDefecit methods of the FitnessTracker class.

This class assumes the user is a male named John Smith. In a single day, John has taken 2000 steps, burned 1000 calories, and was active for 10 minutes. It also assumes that the user entered a maintenance calorie level of 2000.

To simulate a failed test for testCalculateDistance, the calculateDistance method was modified to divide male step length by daily steps taken, rather than multiply.

To simulate a failed test for testFitnessLevel, the fitnessLevel method was modified to not consider users with exactly 1000 calories burned to be moderately active if they also do not have 75 - 150 weekly active minutes (caloriesBurned > 1000 instead of caloriesBurned >= 1000).

To simulate a failed test for testCalculateCalorieDefecit, the calculateCalorieDefecit method's logic was changed from calorieDifference = maintenanceCalories - caloriesBurned to calorieDifference = caloriesBurned - maintenanceCalories.

Since:
JDK 21.0.4
Version:
1.0, 02/18/2025
Author:
Simon Tan

  • Field Details

    • tracker

      private FitnessTracker tracker
      A private FitnessTracker object used for this test class.

    • EPSILON

      private static final double EPSILON
      1.0E-12 A double representing the accepted margin of error.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • maintenanceCalories

      private int maintenanceCalories
      An int that represents the user specified maintenance calorie level. Assumes the user entered 2000.

  • Constructor Details

    • FitnessTrackerTest2

      public FitnessTrackerTest2()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Method that runs before each test is performed and sets up the test environment. Will instantiate the FitnessTracker object with sample user information. Assumes the user is a male named John Smith. In a single day, John has taken 2000 steps, burned 1000 calories, and was active for 10 minutes.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Method that runs after each test is performed and cleans the test environment. Sets the tracker variable to null.

    • testCalculateDistance

      public void testCalculateDistance()
      Method that tests the calculateDistance method. The expected distance walked based on the sample data is 1600.0 meters. The actual distance is calculated using the calculateDistance method. The test will pass if the expected distance is equal to the actual distance, within EPSILON.

    • testFitnessLevel

      public void testFitnessLevel()
      Method that tests the fitnessLevel method. The expected fitness level of the sample user is "Moderately Active" (The user has only 70 weekly active minutes, but has burned 1000 calories). The fitness level is determined using the fitnessLevel method. A wrong fitness level is set to another possible option, "Unknown". The test will pass if the actual fitness level is not equal to the wrong fitness level.

    • testCalculateCalorieDefecit

      public void testCalculateCalorieDefecit()
      Method that tests the calculateCalorieDefecit method. The user must burn more calories to reach maintenance, which would be represented by a positive number returned by the calculateCalorieDefecit method. The calorie defecit is calculated using the calculateCalorieDefecit method. The test will pass if the calorie defecit is greater than zero.
